let s1: Nat satisfy { not prod_fn(a, b, i, s1) >= 0 or sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](m.suc.range, cond_part(prod_fn(a, b, i), is_diag_i))) <= sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](m.suc.range, prod_fn(a, b, i))) }
prod_fn(a, b, i, s1) >= 0
let s2: Nat satisfy { true }

let s3: Nat satisfy { partial[Real](cond_part(prod_fn(a, b, i), is_diag_i), m.suc) = partial[Real](s0, m.suc) or s3 < m.suc and (cond_part(prod_fn(a, b, i), is_diag_i, s3) != diag_cond_prod(a, b, m, i, s3) or partial[Real](cond_part(prod_fn(a, b, i), is_diag_i), m.suc) = partial[Real](s0, m.suc)) }
cond_part(prod_fn(a, b, i), is_diag_i, s3) = diag_cond_prod(a, b, m, i, s3)

let s4: (Nat -> Real, Nat -> Real, Nat, Nat, Nat) -> Real satisfy { forall(x1: Nat -> Real, x2: Nat -> Real, x3: Nat, x4: Nat, x5: Nat) { diag_cond_prod(x1, x2, x3, x4, x5) = s4(x1, x2, x3, x4, x5) } }
sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](m.suc.range, s4(a, b, m, i))) = diag_row_contrib(a, b, m, i)
let s5: Nat -> Real satisfy { true }
sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](m.suc.range, prod_fn(a, b, i))) = row_sum(m.suc, prod_fn(a, b), i)
sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](m.suc.range, cond_part(prod_fn(a, b, i), is_diag_i))) = partial[Real](cond_part(prod_fn(a, b, i), is_diag_i), m.suc)
sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](m.suc.range, s0)) = partial[Real](s0, m.suc)

goal: partial[Real](indicator, bound) * abs_fn(seq_a)(row_idx) = sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](bound.range, scaled))
proof: let s0: Nat satisfy { partial[Real](mul_fn[Nat, Real](abs_fn(seq_a, row_idx), indicator), bound) = partial[Real](scaled, bound) or s0 < bound and (mul_fn(abs_fn(seq_a, row_idx), indicator, s0) != scaled(s0) or partial[Real](mul_fn[Nat, Real](abs_fn(seq_a, row_idx), indicator), bound) = partial[Real](scaled, bound)) }
abs_fn(seq_a, row_idx) * indicator(s0) = scaled(s0)
abs_fn(seq_a, row_idx) * partial[Real](indicator, bound) = partial[Real](mul_fn[Nat, Real](abs_fn(seq_a, row_idx), indicator), bound)
sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](bound.range, scaled)) = partial[Real](scaled, bound)
abs_fn(seq_a, row_idx) * indicator(s0) = mul_fn(abs_fn(seq_a, row_idx), indicator, s0)
partial[Real](indicator, bound) * abs_fn(seq_a, row_idx) = abs_fn(seq_a, row_idx) * partial[Real](indicator, bound)

goal: partial[Real](abs_fn(cauchy_seq(a, b)), n) <= partial[Real](cauchy_seq(abs_fn(a), abs_fn(b)), n)
proof: let s0: Nat satisfy { partial[Real](abs_fn(cauchy_seq(a, b)), n) <= partial[Real](cauchy_seq(abs_fn(a), abs_fn(b)), n) or s0 < n and (not abs_fn(cauchy_seq(a, b), s0) <= cauchy_seq(abs_fn(a), abs_fn(b), s0) or partial[Real](abs_fn(cauchy_seq(a, b)), n) <= partial[Real](cauchy_seq(abs_fn(a), abs_fn(b)), n)) }
cauchy_product(a, b, s0).abs <= cauchy_product(abs_fn(a), abs_fn(b), s0)
abs_fn(cauchy_seq(a, b), s0) = cauchy_seq(a, b, s0).abs

goal: row_sum(n, triangle_fn(prod_fn(a, b), n), i) = row_sum(n, triangle_product(a, b, n), i)
proof: let s0: Nat satisfy { partial[Real](triangle_fn(prod_fn(a, b), n, i), n) = partial[Real](triangle_product(a, b, n, i), n) or s0 < n and (triangle_fn(prod_fn(a, b), n, i, s0) != triangle_product(a, b, n, i, s0) or partial[Real](triangle_fn(prod_fn(a, b), n, i), n) = partial[Real](triangle_product(a, b, n, i), n)) }
triangle_fn(prod_fn(a, b), n, i, s0) = triangle_product(a, b, n, i, s0)
sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](n.range, triangle_fn(prod_fn(a, b), n, i))) = row_sum(n, triangle_fn(prod_fn(a, b), n), i)
sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](n.range, triangle_product(a, b, n, i))) = row_sum(n, triangle_product(a, b, n), i)
sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](n.range, triangle_fn(prod_fn(a, b), n, i))) = partial[Real](triangle_fn(prod_fn(a, b), n, i), n)
sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](n.range, triangle_product(a, b, n, i))) = partial[Real](triangle_product(a, b, n, i), n)

goal: exists(k0: Nat) { tail_bound(partial[Real](abs_fn(a)), lim, k0, eps_half) }
proof: let (s0: (Nat -> Real, Real, Real) -> Nat, s1: (Nat -> Real, Real) -> Real) satisfy { forall(x0: Nat -> Real, x1: Real, x2: Real) { not converges_to(x0, x1) or not x2.is_positive or tail_bound(x0, x1, s0(x0, x1, x2), x2) } and forall(x3: Nat -> Real, x4: Real) { s1(x3, x4).is_positive or converges_to(x3, x4) } and forall(x5: Nat -> Real, x6: Real, x7: Nat) { not tail_bound(x5, x6, x7, s1(x5, x6)) or converges_to(x5, x6) } }
not tail_bound(partial[Real](abs_fn(a)), lim, s0(partial[Real](abs_fn(a)), lim, eps_half), eps_half)
not converges_to(partial[Real](abs_fn(a)), lim) or not eps_half.is_positive or tail_bound(partial[Real](abs_fn(a)), lim, s0(partial[Real](abs_fn(a)), lim, eps_half), eps_half)
converges(partial[Real](abs_fn(a))) = absolutely_converges(a)
not converges(partial[Real](abs_fn(a))) or converges_to(partial[Real](abs_fn(a)), limit(partial[Real](abs_fn(a))))
not diff.abs < eps_half + eps_half or diff.abs <= eps_half + eps_half

tail_triangle_product(abs_fn(a), abs_fn(b), n, i, s0(row, 0)) >= 0
not 0 <= row(s0(row, 0)) or is_lower_bound(row, 0)

not partial[Real](abs_fn(cauchy_seq(a, b)), n) <= partial[Real](abs_fn(a), n) * partial[Real](abs_fn(b), n) or not partial[Real](abs_fn(a), n) * partial[Real](abs_fn(b), n) <= limit(partial[Real](abs_fn(a))) * limit(partial[Real](abs_fn(b))) or partial[Real](abs_fn(cauchy_seq(a, b)), n) <= limit(partial[Real](abs_fn(a))) * limit(partial[Real](abs_fn(b)))

goal: sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](n.range, compose[Nat, Real, Real](Real.abs, row))) = sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](n.range, row_abs))
proof: let s0: Nat satisfy { partial[Real](compose[Nat, Real, Real](Real.abs, row), n) = partial[Real](row_abs, n) or s0 < n and (compose[Nat, Real, Real](Real.abs, row, s0) != row_abs(s0) or partial[Real](compose[Nat, Real, Real](Real.abs, row), n) = partial[Real](row_abs, n)) }

tail_triangle_product(abs_fn(a), abs_fn(b), n, i, s0) = tail_triangle_product(a, b, n, i, s0).abs
sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](n.range, compose[Nat, Real, Real](Real.abs, row))) = partial[Real](compose[Nat, Real, Real](Real.abs, row), n)
sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](n.range, row_abs)) = partial[Real](row_abs, n)
compose[Nat, Real, Real](Real.abs, row, s0) = row(s0).abs

proof: not lib(util).is_transitive[Real](Real.lte) or not 0 <= partial[Real](abs_fn(a), n) or not partial[Real](abs_fn(a), n) <= limit(partial[Real](abs_fn(a))) or 0 <= limit(partial[Real](abs_fn(a)))
not lib(util).is_transitive[Real](Real.lte) or not 0 <= partial[Real](abs_fn(b), n) or not partial[Real](abs_fn(b), n) <= limit(partial[Real](abs_fn(b))) or 0 <= limit(partial[Real](abs_fn(b)))

goal: sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](k.suc.range, diagonal_val(prod_fn(a, b), k))) = sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](k.suc.range, cauchy_coefficient(a, b, k)))
proof: let s0: Nat satisfy { partial[Real](diagonal_val(prod_fn(a, b), k), k.suc) = partial[Real](cauchy_coefficient(a, b, k), k.suc) or s0 < k.suc and (diagonal_val(prod_fn(a, b), k, s0) != cauchy_coefficient(a, b, k, s0) or partial[Real](diagonal_val(prod_fn(a, b), k), k.suc) = partial[Real](cauchy_coefficient(a, b, k), k.suc)) }
a(s0) * b(k - s0) = cauchy_coefficient(a, b, k, s0)
prod_fn(a, b, s0, k - s0) = a(s0) * b(k - s0)
prod_fn(a, b, s0, k - s0) = diagonal_val(prod_fn(a, b), k, s0)
sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](k.suc.range, cauchy_coefficient(a, b, k))) = partial[Real](cauchy_coefficient(a, b, k), k.suc)
sum[Real](map[Nat, Real](k.suc.range, diagonal_val(prod_fn(a, b), k))) = partial[Real](diagonal_val(prod_fn(a, b), k), k.suc)
